devdoc.details: The SelfServeRrpBeaconServerWhitelister contract has the WhitelistExpirationSetterRole and the IndefiniteWhitelisterRole of the RrpBeaconServer contract. The deployer of this contract can specify the beaconIds for which readers can whitelist themselves. The deployer (also the owner) can also add new beaconIds later for readers to self whitelist themselves.

params.rrpBeaconServerAddress: The RrpBeaconServer contract to whitelist readers

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.beaconId: The beaconId to set an expiration timestamp for
params.expirationTimestamp: The expiration timestamp for the beaconId

params.beaconId: The beaconId to set an indefinite whitelist status for
params.indefiniteWhitelistStatus: The indefinite whitelist status for the beaconId

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.reader: The reader to whitelist on the beaconId

devdoc.title: Contract that allows to whitlist readers on the RrpBeaconServer

setBeaconIdToExpirationTimestamp(bytes32.notice: Adds a new beaconId with an expiration timestamp that can be whitelisted by readers

setBeaconIdToIndefiniteWhitelistStatus(b.notice: Adds a new beaconId with an indefinite whitelist status that can be whitelisted by readers indefinetly

whitelistReader(bytes32,address).notice: Whitelists a reader on the RrpBeaconServer with an expiration timestamp
